name: Baltic Exhibition in Malmö
obverse: Bust of Gustaf V facing left.
reverse: Four women carrying bags of fruit. Around them is a ring with the coat of arms of Germany, Sweden, Denmark, and Russia. At the bottom is the coat of arms of Malmö.
description: The Baltic Exhibition was held in Malmö, Sweden from May 15, 1914 through October 4, 1914.
The event showcased the industry, art and culture of Sweden, Denmark, Germany and Russia — the four countries then bordering the Baltic Sea.
There were 3150 examples of this medal minted in bronze.
